metadata.name: Kubernetes Secrets Modified or Deleted
metadata.comment: Detects when Kubernetes Secrets are Modified or Deleted.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM api_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('3') AND lower(resources.name) = lower('secrets') AND (lower(LOWER(api.operation)) in ('create', 'delete', 'patch', 'replace', 'update')))

output.summary: Detects when Kubernetes Secrets are Modified or Deleted.

metadata.objective: False positives: 1. Secrets being modified or deleted may be performed by a system administrator. 2. Automated processes may need to take these actions and may need to be filtered. References: https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/config-api/apiserver-audit.v1/, https://commandk.dev/blog/guide-to-audit-k8s-secrets-for-compliance/
